did.unittitle: Sons and Daughters of Gethsemane, Lodge No. 4, Record book, 1900-1905
did.unitid: Barcode number 1176682/ King George County chancery Reel 121

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Use microfilm copy, King George County chancery Reel 121 image 1.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: The Sons and Daughters of Gethsemane, Lodge No. 4, Record book. Local government records collection, King George County Court Records. The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia 23219.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These materials came to the Library of Virginia in a transfer of court papers from King George County under accession 42662.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: The record book was used as an exhibit in the chancery suit, Moses Jackson and others versus Wesley H. Mauzee and others, heard in the Circuit Court of King George County during the mid-1900s.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Sons and Daughters of Gethsemane, Lodge No. 4, Record book, consists of meeting minutes, payment of dues, attendance, reports of the sick and dead, fines, payment of benefits, officers, and other activities of the organization.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: The Library of Virginia. King George County Court Records. Chancery Records, Moses Jackson and others versus Wesley H. Mauzee and others (Chancery Cause 1906-016).
